channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: No Passports, No Study Abroad: China Limits Public Employees’ Travel
item.description: Even low-level government employees like elementary school teachers and nurses have been ordered to hand in their passports, to enforce “discipline.”

item.title: Former prosecutor Jack Smith, who led criminal probes on Trump, is reportedly under investigation by Office of Special Counsel
item.description: Republican Senator Tom Cotton had reportedly asked the agency to investigate whether Smith's actions had been designed to influence the 2024 election.

item.title: Israel Must Open Its Eyes
item.description: Defeating Hamas does not require starving a single child.

item.title: With Festivities and Papal Prayer, the Vatican Aims to Attract the Young
item.description: At a gathering that has been called the “Catholic Woodstock,” the church has embraced influencers on social media as a way to engage the youth.

item.title: Earthquake Jolts New Jersey and New York City
item.description: The epicenter of the 3.0-magnitude quake, which struck around 10:20 p.m. on Saturday, was near Teterboro Airport in New Jersey.

item.title: U.S. Victims of Hamas and Hezbollah Attacks Sue UNRWA
item.description: Relatives of people killed in terrorist attacks accuse the agency that aids Palestinians of providing support to the armed groups.

item.title: With Festivities and Papal Prayer, the Vatican Aims to Attract the Young
item.description: At a gathering that has been called the “Catholic Woodstock,” the church has embraced influencers on social media as a way to engage the youth.

item.title: A Former American Soldier Finds a Home in Mexican Wrestling
item.description: Flip Gordon was uneasy about being a lucha libre wrestler dressed in a U.S. military uniform. Booed at first, he is now a fan favorite.

item.title: David Rendall, Tenor Who Suffered Operatic Mishaps, Dies at 76
item.description: He appeared regularly at the Metropolitan Opera and sang in major European opera houses, but a stage accident in 2005 nearly ended his career.

item.title: Map: 5.8-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Mexico
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: No Passports, No Study Abroad: China Limits Public Employees’ Travel
item.description: Even low-level government employees like elementary school teachers and nurses have been ordered to hand in their passports, to enforce “discipline.”

item.title: OPEC+ agrees in principle to another bumper supply increase
item.description: Saudi Arabia and its partners plan to ratify the addition of 548,000 barrels a day for next month when they hold a video conference on Sunday.

item.title: The Federal Reserve’s power: Congress giveth and Congress can taketh away
item.description: "Don't forget, our Federal Reserve is not at all a part of our Constitution. It's a creature of the U.S. Congress, created by the Federal Reserve Act ...

item.title: I’m a cybersecurity CEO who advises over 9,000 agencies and Sam Altman is wrong that the AI fraud crisis is coming—it’s already here
item.description: We may soon recognize a "Moore's Law"-style principle for AI that I call “Altman’s Law”: every 180 days, AI capabilities double.

item.title: I’m a former governor, an education leader, and mother to recent college grads. Gen Z alarms me with their financial illiteracy
item.description: Gen Z is the least financially literate generation on record. I see it in the workforce and with my own kids graduating college.
